talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: Again, the point isn't that this rhetoric alienates dyed in the wool right-wingers. It's that it alienates people who voted for Trump despite not being dyed in the wool right-wingers -- people who can be persuaded to vote for a Democrat in the future.

talk.author: did:plc:rg6we7j27afow3hvgecd6xpn
talk.utter:
There are DOZENS of think pieces on those exact people, though. They're constantly referred to and interviewed. We're  constantly asked to reach out to them.

Has anyone in the major media interviewing them ever asked them to reach back?

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: Why would a journalist do that? That's not their job.

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: Why would a journalist do that? That's not their job.

talk.author: did:plc:rg6we7j27afow3hvgecd6xpn
talk.utter:
Why would a journalist ever ask a slightly challenging question in an interview?  Why would a journalist ever notice a disparity in who they interview and who they never bother to interview?

Yes, both of those are parts of their job.

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: "Asking them to reach back" is not a challenging question. It's a request.

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: Again, the point isn't that this rhetoric alienates dyed in the wool right-wingers. It's that it alienates people who voted for Trump despite not being dyed in the wool right-wingers -- people who can be persuaded to vote for a Democrat in the future.

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: Prove what? That there are people who voted for Trump who might vote for Democrats in the future?

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: Prove what? That there are people who voted for Trump who might vote for Democrats in the future?

talk.author: did:plc:3mafc5xgys7rvwdoac5qi2z6
talk.utter: Prove this: "It's that it alienates people who voted for Trump despite not being dyed in the wool right-wingers -- people who can be persuaded to vote for a Democrat in the future."  Liberals have been tone-policing black people for decades, but none of y'all can prove there's any benefit to it.

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: Who exactly is talking about tone policing black people?
